bugs.title: CVE-2021-21775 webkit2gtk3: webkitgtk: A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the way certain events are processed for ImageLoader objects of WebKit. [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-21775 webkit2gtk3: webkitgtk: A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the way certain events are processed for ImageLoader objects of WebKit. [fedora-all]

long_desc.thetext:
This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1986863,1986864

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
According to https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2021-0004.html this is fixed in WebKitGTK 2.32.3.
FEDORA-2021-cf7d8c7b1a has been submitted as an update to Fedora 34. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-cf7d8c7b1a
FEDORA-2021-3de956ceee has been submitted as an update to Fedora 33. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-3de956ceee

FEDORA-2021-cf7d8c7b1a has been pushed to the Fedora 34 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-2021-3de956ceee has been pushed to the Fedora 33 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2021-21779 webkit2gtk3: webkitgtk: A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the way that WebKit GraphicsContext handles certain events. [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-21779 webkit2gtk3: webkitgtk: A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the way that WebKit GraphicsContext handles certain events. [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-21779 webkitgtk: Use-after-free in WebCore::GraphicsContext leading to information leak and possibly code execution

long_desc.thetext: A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the way that WebKit GraphicsContext handles certain events. A specially crafted web page can lead to a potential information leak and further memory corruption. A victim must be tricked into visiting a malicious web page to trigger this vulnerability.

Created webkit2gtk3 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1986867]

Upstream advisory:

https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2021-0004.html

Talos advisory with more details:

https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2021-1238

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4381 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4381

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-21779

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by catanzaro.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'failed'.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'waiting'.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'failed'.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'passed'.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by catanzaro.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
* Properly set the cookies settings after a network process crash.
 * Fix accessibility tree after a cross site navigation with PSON enabled.
 * Ensure WebKitScriptWorld::window-object-cleared signal is always emitted.
 * Fix several crashes and rendering issues.
 * Security fixes: CVE-2021-21775, CVE-2021-21779, CVE-2021-30663, CVE-2021-30665, CVE-2021-30689, CVE-2021-30720, CVE-2021-30734, CVE-2021-30744, CVE-2021-30749, CVE-2021-30795, CVE-2021-30797, CVE-2021-30799
title: webkit2gtk3-2.32.3-1.fc34
